Name: com
Title: Communication
Description: [Server MITM] Communication from outer space ! You are receiving communications on the 172.28.1{teamID}.5 of your radio. Tune your radio on this frequency and try to decode the traffic.

Name: inject
Title: Sisyphus
Description: [Injection track] (Regex, JCR SQL2, SOLR, MongoDB). Choose your difficulty level so that your are able to submit flags of a FLR track this year. Do the injection once or many times. To have details about the flags, please read track instructions at sisyphus.ctf.hf

Name: galaxy7
Title: Galaxy 7
Description:
[Electronics Track] Galaxy7 is a dangerous reactor, named after Samsung's fail in 2016. Hack the board to discover its feature and terminate the reactor.
Note:For every flag on the reactor, they will be printed on the USB serial port.

Name: sgcomplex
Title: Stargate Complex
Description: [Exploration/Scripting Track] An old man gave you the secret coordinates and his access code to the hidden location of the Giza StarGate, venture to this top-secret complex to discover then defeat the security mechanisms protecting the StarGate in order to travel to other worlds. Rumors says a status page can be found at http://stargate.ctf.hf

Name: sgwormhole
Title: Stargate Wormholes
Description: [Bruteforce/Scripting] Once the StarGate is operational, find the correct coordinates to other StarGates all around the Milky Way. There is another rumor the other StarGates are broadcasting their coordinates thru the universe, however this has never been confirmed nor denied.

Name: sgmisc
Title: Stargate Miscellaneous
Description: Miscellaneous flags for the StarGate challenge

Name: perseid
Title: Perseid
Description: [Exploit Track] Some satellites are gona be in scope for the next 10 hours. Find their IP here and some shells!

Name: phenix
Title: Phenix Corp Golgoth
Description: Dynamic Attack, CrackMe, ReverseMe, RussianDoll, Entertainment plateform .... or not ;)

Name: et
Title: ET Phone Home
Description: [VOIP Track] It's like a POV but you got to str.reverse().remove('I');

Name: misc
Title: Miscellaneous
Description: Flags all around the room, on the leach or else

Name: bug
Title: Bug Bounty
Description: Bug Bounty Policy. Flags given for teams who raise security issues in the infrastructure. These are one timers.

Name: bonus
Title: Bonus
Description: Bonus Flags are used for non-standard flag types. For example, to give a bonus when a track is completed, a bonus flag is created and assigned to the team
